CMultiXLink Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class encapsulates all the logic of handling all data transfer between any two entities using different transport layers. It enables client connections, server connections, sending and receiving binary data. The methdod used for data transfer is independent of the transport layer. All actions performed by this class are asynchronous, this means that any connection or data transfer call is queued for execution and when execution is completed it calls one of its virtual functions to notify the application of the completion. a CMultiXLink derived object can be one of 2 types : Raw or non Raw. A non Raw Link is a one that MultiX takes full responsibility of and handles all data transfer of that link. it is used by MultiX for inter process communications with other MultiX Based applications, using the MultiX protocol. The only functions that an application can use on a non RAW links is Connect() and Listen(). RAW links are used by the application. MultiX only helps in queueing the data to send or received and forwards events to the application regarding the state of the link. MultiX does not alter the data it receives or sends over RAW links. CMultiXLink can support a varaiety of transport protocols, currently it support only TCP/IP sockets.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CMultiXLink::LinkState

Possible values for the state of a link.

Enumerator:
LinkClosed  Never opened.
LinkOpened  Opened, but not connected yet.
LinkConnected  Connected.
LinkDisconnected  was connected and then disconnected
LinkClosing  Closing.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CMultiXLink::CMultiXLink ( TTpmConfigParams *  Params,
MultiXLinkType  LinkType = MultiXLinkTypeTcp,
MultiXOpenMode  OpenMode = MultiXOpenModeClient,
bool  bRaw = false,
int  MaxReadSize = 4096 
) [protected]

Default constructor for this base class.

Parameters:
Params runtime parameters as configured by MultiXTpm, a name, value pair collection.
LinkType see MultiXLinkType , default is Tcp socket.
OpenMode see MultiXOpenMode , default is client
bRaw true if the link is RAW , default is non RAW , the link will be used by MultiX only.
MaxReadSize the size that MultiX will use for read operations. default is 4096. The larger the number, less read operation are required when a bulk of data is received, if small amounts of data are expected, a smaller size can be used, saveing buffer space.

Member Function Documentation

std::string CMultiXLink::DebugPrint ( int  Level,
LPCTSTR  pFormat,
  ... 
)

Used to print a diagnostic message to the console (or to the debug window on windows platforms if the debugger is active).

Parameters:
Level the function will print the message and return text only if Level is less then the value returned by the function DebugLevel()
pFormat a printf like format.
Returns:
A string containing the actual formated text.

bool CMultiXLink::Close (  ) 

Closes a link that previuosly was opened using Connect(), Listen() or AcceptNew().

Returns:
false if the link was never opened, true otherwise.

bool CMultiXLink::Send ( CMultiXBuffer &  Buf,
bool  bCopyBuf = false 
)

Queues a buffer for transmition over a connected link.

Parameters:
Buf A non empty CMultiXBuffer to send
bCopyBuf if set to true, MultiX creates a new buffer and copies the content to the new buffer, in this case the original buffer can be modified after the Send operation. If set to false, MultiX clones the buffer and if the original buffer is changed before MultiX transmits the buffer, the changed content will be transmitted.
Returns:
false if the link is not connected or is not RAW.

bool CMultiXLink::Connect ( std::string  RemoteName,
std::string  RemotePort 
)

Issue a client connection to a remote application.

It is used to to connect to a remote application on a remote or local host assuming the remote application is listenning on the specified port.

Parameters:
RemoteName the name of the remote host, it can be its IP address using DOT format or its DNS name.
RemotePort Tcp Port to use for connection
Returns:
false if unable to queue a connect request.

bool CMultiXLink::Listen ( std::string  LocalPort,
std::string  LocalName = "" 
)

Wait for a connection.

It is used to wait for incomming connection on a specific or all adapters on the local machine. Any new connection to the local application will be completed by MultiX calling the virtual function AcceptNew(). Until this link is closed, it will continue to listen for new connections.

Parameters:
LocalPort port name or number to listen on. If a name is provided, it must appear in the "etc/services" file.
LocalName The IP address of the local interface to listen on. if empty , or not specified , it will listen on all available interfaces on the local machine.
Returns:
false if unable to queue the listen request.

virtual CMultiXLink* CMultiXLink::AcceptNew (  )  [inline, virtual]

Called by MultiX to enable the application create a new instance of the CMultiXLink derived object.

When a new connection is established as a result of a Listen() request, MultiX calls this virtual function to let the application create the correct object for that connection. If the application does not implement this virtual function or if it returns NULL, the new connection is closed and no session is established.

Returns:
A pointer to the newly created CMultiXLink derived object.

int CMultiXLink::GetIntParam ( std::string  ParamName,
int  DefaultValue 
)

Use this function get MultiXTpm configured parameter.

When an application is started by MultiXTpm, it might receive some congured runtime parameters as a Name,Value pairs collection. Use this function to access an integer type parameter identified by ParamName. If the parameter is not found or has an invalid value, the DefaultValue is retuned.

Parameters:
ParamName The name of the parameter who's value you want to find.
DefaultValue The value that will be returned if not found or has invalid value.
Returns:
The value of the parameter.

std::string CMultiXLink::GetStringParam ( std::string  ParamName,
std::string  DefaultValue 
)

Use this function get MultiXTpm configured parameter.

When an application is started by MultiXTpm, it might receive some congured runtime parameters as a Name,Value pairs collection. Use this function to access an std::string type parameter identified by ParamName. If the parameter is not found, the DefaultValue is retuned.

Parameters:
ParamName The name of the parameter who's value you want to find.
DefaultValue The value that will be returned if not found.
Returns:
The value of the parameter.

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnLinkClosed (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a link is closed.

When a link is closed by the application or as a result of a disconnect from the remote peer, MultiX calls this virtual function to inform the application that the link is closed. If the function returns false, MultiX will delete the object and remove it from its tables , otherwise it is the responsibility of the application to delete the object (Link).

Returns:
false to enable MultiX to delete the object, true - to let the application do the cleanup.

virtual void CMultiXLink::OnDataReceived ( CMultiXBuffer &  Buf  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when data arrives for the link.

Whenever data arrives for that link, MultiX notifys the application and it passes it a reference to a CMultiXBuffer object. when the function returns, the buffer is removed by MultiX, so if the application needs to use the data after it returns, it should save the data in the buffer before it returns.

Parameters:
Buf The buffer containning the data.

virtual void CMultiXLink::OnSendDataCompleted ( CMultiXBuffer &  Buf  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a send operation completed successfully.

Parameters:
Buf The buffer that contains the data that was sent

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnSendDataFailed ( CMultiXBuffer &  Buf  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a send operation failed.

Parameters:
Buf The buffer that contains the data that was trying to send.
Returns:
false to let MultiX close the link, true to tell MultiX to ignore the failure.

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnLinkDisconnected (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX to notify the application that the link has been disconnected.

Returns:
false to let MultiX close the link.

virtual void CMultiXLink::OnLinkConnected (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX to notify the application that the link has been connected.

Once this function is called, the application may start transferring data over the link.

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnListenFailed ( int  IoError  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a listen operation failed.

Parameters:
IoError see MultiXErrorEnum
Returns:
false to let MultiX close the link

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnConnectFailed ( int  IoError  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a connect operation failed.

Parameters:
IoError see MultiXErrorEnum
Returns:
false to let MultiX close the link

virtual void CMultiXLink::OnOpenCompleted (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX to notify the application that the link is opened and waiting for Connect or Listen to complete.

This function is called only to inform the application that the last Listen/Connect request was queued successfully and the no error occured. When the Connect or Listen will be completed, MultiX will inform the application using On LinkConnected().

virtual bool CMultiXLink::OnOpenFailed ( int  IoError  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by MultiX when a Connect or Listen operation failed.

Parameters:
IoError see MultiXErrorEnum
Returns:
false to let MultiX close the link
